Package projects.phonebook.utils

Class PrimeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.phonebook.utils.PrimeGenerator
  • public class PrimeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

    PrimeGenerator is a simple immutable class which stores and retrieves prime numbers. Since we use this class from within the context of HashTable instances, we implement the scheme that we have talked about in class: whenever a hash table wants to enlarge, it will make a call to getNextPrime(), which will provide it with the largest prime smaller than two times the current prime. This does not simply mean that the current index into our collection of primes should be doubled, since primes are not uniformly distributed on the line of positive integers!

    **** DO NOT EDIT THIS CLASS! ******

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    HashTable, NoMorePrimesException, getNextPrime(), getPreviousPrime()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PrimeGenerator()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getCurrPrime()
      Retrieves the prime number pointed to by internal storage.
      int getNextPrime()
      Returns the greatest prime smaller than twice the current prime.
      int getPreviousPrime()
      Returns the smallest prime larger than half the current prime.
      void reset()
      Resets the PrimeGenerator instance, making the next call to getCurrPrime() return 13.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrimeGenerator

        public PrimeGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrPrime

        public int getCurrPrime()
        Retrieves the prime number pointed to by internal storage. Without any calls to getNextPrime() or getPreviousPrime(), this method returns 7 (i.e, a new PrimeGenerator instance returns 13 through this method).
        Returns:
        The current prime number, 7 by default.

      • getNextPrime

        public int getNextPrime()
                 throws NoMorePrimesException
        Returns the greatest prime smaller than twice the current prime. This is an approach that allows instances of HashTable to find new hash table sizes which provide a good trade-off between memory footprint and making future insertions happen without resizing the table.
        Returns:
        The first prime number greater than twice the current prime number.
        Throws:
        NoMorePrimesException - If there is no such prime number to return from our list.

      • getPreviousPrime

        public int getPreviousPrime()
                     throws NoMorePrimesException
        Returns the smallest prime larger than half the current prime. This is an approach that allows instances of HashTable to find new hash table sizes which provide a good trade-off between memory footprint and making future deletions happen without resizing the table.
        Returns:
        The first prime number greater than half the current prime number.
        Throws:
        NoMorePrimesException - If there is no such prime number to return from our list.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the PrimeGenerator instance, making the next call to getCurrPrime() return 13.
